gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਨੈਨ ਬੈਨ ਪੰਖ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਸ੍ਰਬੰਗ ਮੋਰ ਤਾ ਕੇ ਪਗ ਓਰ ਦੇਖਿ ਦੋਖ ਨ ਬੀਚਾਰੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Nain Bain Pankh Soundar Srabang Mora , Taa Kay Pag Aor Daykhi Dokh N Beechaareeai ?
translation: Just as a peacock's eyes, call, feathers and all other limbs are beautiful, one should not condemn him for his ugly feet. (see the merits alone).

gurmukhi: ਸੰਦਲ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਅਤਿ ਕੋਮਲ ਕਮਲ ਜੈਸੇ ਕੰਟਕਿ ਬਿਲੋਕ ਨ ਅੳੁਗਨ ੳੁਰਧਾਰੀਅੈ
transliteration: Sandal Sougandh Ati Komal Kamal Jaisay , Kantaki Bilok N Aougan Uradhaareeai ?
translation: Just as Sandalwood is very fragrant and lotus flower very delicate, one should not bring to mind their demerit of the fact that a snake generally wraps itself around the sandalwood tree while a lotus flower has thorn on its stem.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਫਲ ਮਿਸਟਿ ਗੁਨਾਦਿ ਸ੍ਵਾਦ ਬੀਜ ਕਰਵਾੲੀ ਕੈ ਬੁਰਾੲੀ ਨ ਸਮਾਰੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Anmrit Dhal Misati Gounaadi Svaada , Beej Karavaaee Kai Buraaee N Samaareeai ?
translation: Just as a mango is sweet and delicious but its kernal's bitterness should not be thought of.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਦਾਨ ਸਬਹੂੰ ਸੈ ਮਾਂਗਿ ਲੀਜੈ ਬੰਦਨਾ ਸਕਲ ਭੂਤ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਨ ਤਕਾਰੀਅੈ ||੩੯੯||
transliteration: Taisay Gur Giaan Daan Sabahoon Sai Maangi Leejai , Bandanaa Sakal Bhoot Nindaa N Takaareeai ?399?
translation: Similarly one should take Guru's word and his sermons from everyone and everywhere. Everyone should be respected also. No one should be ever slandered and condemned for his demerit.
